p: CHIKV are phylogenetically classified into three major genotypes, the West Africa, the Asia, and the East-Central South Africa (ECSA). The Asian genotype was the cause of recent outbreaks in the Caribbean and United States [ 14]. In Brazil, both Asian and ECSA genotypes have been reported, with the outbreak in Rio de Janeiro beginning in 2014, being attributed to the ECSA genotype [ 9, 15, 16]. It has been reported that phylogenetic diversification and infectivity differences among CHIKV may be correlated [ 17] and the evolution of CHIKV may be related to the viral adaptation in mosquito vectors and mammalian hosts.
